metadata.synopsis: Post EADialogue with Wyll after Druid Attack. In most cases, this will involve him training a tiefling child before the player breaks in, and you discover you were both on the mind flayer ship. Wyll comes across as a big-time hero, and wants help killing goblins. He is called the Blade of Frontiers by most.

32.speaker: Wyll
32.text: The Blade of Frontiers, at your calling.

137.speaker: Player
137.text: Come on. I think it's time we go on a devil hunt.

122.speaker: Player
122.text: I'd like to join up and find a cure for this parasite of ours.

157.speaker: Player
157.text: Go and wait for me in camp.

34.speaker: Wyll
34.text: You were a marvel to behold! Even Balduran himself would bow to such formidable talent.

20.speaker: Wyll
20.text: Introductions are in order. The Blade of Frontiers, at your...

2.speaker: Narrator
2.text: *The man's smile bends downward, and his thoughts become yours.*

111.speaker: Narrator
111.text: *You are the Blade of Frontiers, racing through the wastes of Avernus. Just ahead, a diabolical figure - red skin, single curled horn - blazes with flame, bloodied greataxe held high.*

23.speaker: Narrator
23.text: *It's Karlach - the woman you met in the wilds.*

65.speaker: Wyll
65.text: Hells' great fires - you were on the ship.

153.speaker: Player
153.text: Yes - and we both carry parasites.

68.speaker: Wyll
68.text: Mm - doomed to shed our skin and become illithid, or so the stories go.

81.speaker: Wyll
81.text: But I haven't sprouted any tentacles - not yet, anyway. Nor have you. Could just be good luck. I'm not so...

83.speaker: Narrator
83.text: *Your minds collide once more. Wyll chases the fiend, ignited with rancour. She is an infernal wardevil, a threat to the living - evil incarnate.*

92.speaker: Wyll
92.text: Shit - you saw her: advocatus diaboli.

89.speaker: Player
89.text: *Advocatus diaboli. A devil's advocate - a champion in the Blood War between diabolical forces and demons.*

164.speaker: Narrator
164.text: *Advocatus diaboli. A devil's advocate - a champion in the Blood War between diabolical forces and demons.*

148.text: *Advocatus diaboli. A devil's advocate - a champion in the Blood War between diabolical forces and demons.*

95.speaker: Narrator
95.text: *Advocatus diaboli. A devil's advocate - a champion in the Blood War between diabolical forces and demons.*

145.speaker: Player
145.text: I met a group of paladins who were also seeking this devil.

39.speaker: Wyll
39.text: I'm not surprised. My target is well-known for her brutality in service of her evil mistress.

135.speaker: Player
135.text: Also known as Karlach. She's in the wilds, some ways from here.

15.speaker: Wyll
15.text: You met her? Then you were subject to her lies.

26.speaker: Wyll
26.text: Karlach is an archdevil's soldier I swore on my good eye to kill.

6.speaker: Wyll
6.text: I tracked her through the Hells to the mind flayer ship. But the damned illithids infected me before I could end her.

70.speaker: Wyll
70.text: She's out there now, preying on the innocent. I don't kill her, she'll leave behind nothing but a trail of corpses.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: Are you sure? Karlach doesn't seem like some rampaging devil to me.

108.speaker: Wyll
108.text: You met her? So she filled you with lies.

102.speaker: Wyll
102.text: I've seen her myself, tearing through the Hells on behalf of her mistress, Zariel.

124.speaker: Wyll
124.text: We can't leave her be. Who knows how many lives she might take?

14.speaker: Player
14.text: Let's join forces. I'll help you cast this devil back into the Hells.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: Chk. A tadpole feasts on our skulls, and you're signing on to chase devils?

24.speaker: Lae'zel
24.text: Chk. A tadpole feasts on our skulls, and you're signing on to chase devils?

44.speaker: Player
44.text: I'm looking to cure this infection. I suggest we partner up.

138.speaker: Wyll
138.text: I haven't sprouted any tentacles yet, thank Balduran.

141.speaker: Wyll
141.text: But good luck can't last forever. Invitation accepted.

84.speaker: Wyll
84.text: I'll need to talk to your leader if you want to partner up, though.

90.speaker: Wyll
90.text: Besides, I watched you at the gate. I could use an ally like you.

172.speaker: Wyll
172.text: You'll need to make room if you want to partner up, though.

127.speaker: Player
127.text: You have a mind flayer tadpole in your head. Doesn't that worry you?

17.speaker: Wyll
17.text: I'd be a fool if it didn't. I know the stories - doomed to shed my skin, become illithid. And there's no coming back.

3.speaker: Wyll
3.text: But I haven't sprouted any tentacles - least not yet, thank Balduran.

166.speaker: Wyll
166.text: Could just be good luck. But sooner or later, it's bound to run out.

101.speaker: Player
101.text: Join me, then. We'll search for a cure.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: Chk - a worthy ally, perhaps. But I'll waste no time chasing devils while a tadpole feasts on our skulls.

107.speaker: Lae'zel
107.text: Chk - a worthy ally, perhaps. But I'll waste no time chasing devils while a tadpole feasts on our skulls.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: Trust me, gith - I know the stories. Doomed to shed our skin and become illithid. And they say there's no coming back.

40.speaker: Wyll
40.text: Trust me, gith - I know the stories. Doomed to shed our skin and become illithid. And they say there's no coming back.

146.speaker: Wyll
146.text: But I've seen your people in battle. I reckon you are no mere warrior, but a godsdamned army. If anyone can overcome this tadpole, it's you.

51.speaker: Wyll
51.text: I've seen your people in battle. I reckon you are no mere warrior, but a godsdamned army.

170.speaker: Wyll
170.text: I'd be a fool to let you turn your back. Pledge me your talents, and I'll pledge you mine.

131.speaker: Wyll
131.text: I'll presume that's githyanki for 'yes'. Now let's move.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: Hmph - the famous Blade of Frontiers, in the flesh. Clever, this hero act you've got going.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: Hmph - the famous Blade of Frontiers, in the flesh. Clever, this hero act you've got going.

58.speaker: Shadowheart
58.text: Hmph - the famous Blade of Frontiers, in the flesh. Clever, this hero act you've got going.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: 'Hero,' 'Blade' - names strangers gave me. My friends call me 'Wyll'.

105.speaker: Wyll
105.text: 'Hero,' 'Blade' - names strangers gave me. My friends call me 'Wyll'.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: Excellent. If we ever become friends, I'll know what to call you.

100.speaker: Shadowheart
100.text: Excellent. If we ever become friends, I'll know what to call you.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: Oh my. This is going to be a fun journey.

150.speaker: Player
150.text: Oh my. This is going to be a fun journey.

74.speaker: Astarion
74.text: Oh my. This is going to be a fun journey.

0.speaker: Wyll
0.text: I'd welcome the company - but your leader should make the decision.

38.speaker: Wyll
38.text: A splendid plan. We'll talk more there.

144.speaker: Wyll
144.text: A splendid plan. We'll talk more there.

155.speaker: Narrator
155.text: *Evil sets upon your thoughts. Killing a legend could make you a famous villain indeed.*

103.speaker: Narrator
103.text: *Death or Glory, Wyll? This way lies only death...*

28.speaker: Wyll
28.text: I like your thinking. Besides, I watched you at the gate. I could use an ally like you.

67.speaker: Wyll
67.text: An excellent suggestion - but your party's full up.

99.speaker: Wyll
99.text: Still - when the time comes, call for the Blade. I won't be long to answer.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: Go to my camp and wait for me.

88.speaker: Player
88.text: If you're going to beat that devil of yours, you'll need my help.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: Good luck with your devil problem - it seems your work's cut out for you.

121.speaker: Wyll
121.text: Well met - and call on me if you find a fix for this affliction of ours. Might even join you once that devil's met my blade.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: Hunting in the Hells. Dangerous territory, don't you think?

8.speaker: Wyll
8.text: I'm no stranger to the infernal. Better to slay a devil before her fires burn common folk to ash.

116.speaker: Player
116.text: Cavorting with devils, I see. You should consider better company.

133.speaker: Wyll
133.text: A fiend makes for poor company - unless it's been stuffed and mounted on your wall.

169.speaker: Player
169.text: A Devil's Advocate. Do you think she'll bring the Blood War to Faerûn?

5.speaker: Wyll
5.text: That ship's sailed the Styx already. All I can hope for's to limit the damage.

161.speaker: Wyll
161.text: Karlach's her name. An archdevil's soldier I swore on my good eye to kill.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: Another escapee? Thank the gods - I need all the friends I can get.

134.speaker: Wyll
134.text: Better friends than the ones hitching a ride in our skulls, at least.

128.speaker: Wyll
128.text: I'm sure you know the stories. Doomed to shed our skin and become illithid. And they say there's no coming back.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: Who was that woman, the one in your thoughts?

151.speaker: Wyll
151.text: You saw her, then. Advocatus diaboli.

123.speaker: Narrator
123.text: *You see the fiend again, and ignite with Wyll's rancour. She is an infernal wardevil, a threat to the living - evil incarnate.*

98.speaker: Wyll
98.text: Shit - you saw her: advocatus diaboli.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: I'm more concerned about the parasite. I suggest we search for a healer together.

156.text: I'm more concerned about the parasite. I suggest we search for a healer together.

31.text: I'm more concerned about the parasite. I suggest we search for a healer together.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: I'm more concerned about the parasite. I suggest we search for a healer together.

46.speaker: Wyll
46.text: You are the company you keep. And you have chosen poor company.

79.speaker: Wyll
79.text: I will find you, Karlach. And you will meet my blade.

82.speaker: Wyll
82.text: The druids, dead - a damn shame to see.

132.speaker: Wyll
132.text: You cut 'em down clean - and as well you should. Kagha was a monster, poisoned almost the whole lot.

87.speaker: Wyll
87.text: The Blade of Frontiers, ever at your service - and ever in awe of your skill.

129.speaker: Wyll
129.text: Have you thought about my offer? We would make potent allies.

91.speaker: Wyll
91.text: You were a marvel to behold! Even Balduran himself would bow to such formidable talent.

112.speaker: Wyll
112.text: Well met. The Blade of Frontiers at your -

63.speaker: Narrator
63.text: *Your minds become one. The man sees a familiar figure in your thoughts: red skin, curled horn. Karlach.*

149.speaker: Wyll
149.text: Hold your tongue. It's not you I want - it's Karlach. Send her over.

165.speaker: Wyll
165.text: Oh, and a piece of advice: don't play with devils unless you don't mind getting burnt.

94.speaker: Wyll
94.text: It's Karlach I want. I'll be waiting.

114.speaker: Narrator
114.text: *The man's face falls as recognition sets in. He knows you, and you know him: the so-called hero known as the Blade of Frontiers, hunter of monsters - and devils.*

50.speaker: Narrator
50.text: *His thoughts become yours. You are the Blade of Frontiers, racing through the wastes of Avernus after a diabolical figure blazing in flame. Racing after you.*

52.speaker: Player
52.text: Fuck's sake. You have to let this chase go. I'm not who you think I am.

71.speaker: Wyll
71.text: I am the Blade. I will chase my prey until death takes me.

78.speaker: Wyll
78.text: I know what you are. I know who you serve.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: It's about time we met face-to-face. Nice to meet you at last, Wyll.

9.speaker: Wyll
9.text: Don't act like we're friends, devil. I know what you are. I know who you serve.

86.speaker: Wyll
86.text: And I know this grove is in danger as long as you walk the Coast.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: I'm not going to hurt these people. We saved them from goblins together, remember?

97.speaker: Wyll
97.text: Gain their trust now, and prime their souls for the reaping. I know the tricks.

85.speaker: Wyll
85.text: For the sake of these people, I'll stay my blade. Go, enjoy your breaths while you can still take them.

126.speaker: Player
126.text: You still don't get it. I'm running from Zariel, not working for her.

120.speaker: Wyll
120.text: You think I don't know the truth? How your flesh blazes with Avernus' heat? How your axe splits your victims straight down the middle?

66.speaker: Player
66.text: And what do you plan to do about it? Kill me?

104.speaker: Wyll
104.text: Yes - but not here. For the sake of these people, I'll stay my blade.

41.speaker: Wyll
41.text: Go, enjoy every breath while you can still take them.

72.speaker: Wyll
72.text: Trust me - I won't be far behind.

59.speaker: Player
59.text: What do you know. Looks like I'm not the only one who hitched a ride on the nautiloid.

163.speaker: Wyll
163.text: You should have stayed in the hells, devil.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: You followed me all the way here just to find out I'm no devil, you know.

139.speaker: Wyll
139.text: Well met. The Blade of Frontiers at your -
